intro: Christella glanduligera, commonly known as the glandular christella, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are simple and alternate, often covered in fine, glandular hairs. Christella glanduligera is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
